plugins.name: CoverCraft - Figma x Hashnode
plugins.description:
Are you creating cover images for your Hashnode Post ? Constantly downloading, naming, renaming files and switching platforms just to ensure your cover image looks perfect. We've been there, and we understand your frustration.


But fret not, because CoverCraft is here to save the day! Say goodbye to all the hassle and frustration. With CoverCraft, certainly no more platform switching.


Imagine being able to craft your cover images in Figma and seamlessly set them on your Hashnode blog posts with just a few clicks. That's the power of CoverCraft - simplifying your workflow and allowing you to focus on what truly matters: crafting your cover.


Features:


Firstly, To Unlock the full potential of CoverCraft you need access token. Don't have a token yet? No worries â€“ create access token


1) Set Cover Images:


  • While plugin is open, Select image or frame containing your cover image. Next, choose the post in which you want to set the selected image as the cover, currently we support published post.
  • Finally, Click Set as Cover to apply the selected image or frame as the cover for the chosen post.


2) Generate your Imagination:


  • We discovered that users often struggled with selecting the perfect background image. To address this, Introducing Lexica AI into plugin to Generate Images from Prompt. Search for Background Images based on your imagination.
  • Open plugin and run in file where you aim to build Cover Image.
  • Navigate to the Search Cover Tab, Enter your imaginative prompt to initiate the Search. Browse through the generated images and select the one that resonates with your vision.
  • Witness the magic by clicking on image and make your cover. Once your newly created cover image is ready, set without ever leaving Figma.


3) Dark and Light Mode Support:


  • Our plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma's preference theme, offering support for both dark and light modes. This means that regardless of your chosen theme in Figma, our plugin will automatically adjust its appearance to match.
  • This ensures a consistent and comfortable user experience. If preferred working theme is dark, our plugin will automatically detect and switch to dark mode. Conversely, if you opt for a light theme, the plugin will effortlessly transition to light mode.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Set Cover Images from Figma to Hashnode

plugins.name: Name Slayer
plugins.description:
Slay your layer names

  1. Select layer(s) with styles or variables directly applied to them (color, text and effect).
  2. Preview how many layers will be renamed, already match their style/variable name, have no styles applied, or if part of your selection has more than one style/variable applied to the same layer.
  3. Click Rename layer!


This plugin is a great complement to Styler, when style names and layer names become out of sync.


Notes

  1. Name Slayer supports color variables and color styles applied to either a fill or stroke, as well as text styles and effect styles.
  2. Layers with more than one style or variable canâ€™t be renamed â€“ layers must have a single style or variable to know what to rename it to.
  3. Styles which alias variables will be rename to the style, not the variable within.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer â€¢ Plugin Author â€¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Easily rename layers to match the name of their applied styles and variables.

plugins.name: Copy-writer agent
plugins.description:
Content Writer Agent: Your Content AI Text Assistant in Figma


Tired of manually tweaking text, fixing typos, translating snippets, or shortening

content within your Figma designs? Content Writer Agent brings the power of

advanced AI directly into your workflow, saving you time and boosting your creativity!

Select any text layers, give a simple instruction (like "Make this more formal",

"Translate to German", "Fix grammar", or "Summarize"), and let the AI handle the

heavy lifting. See the changes side-by-side, compare with the original, and replace

text with a single click.


Key Features:

  1. AI-Powered Editing: Use prompts to rewrite, translate, fix grammar,
  2. shorten, or modify selected text layers.
  3. Side-by-Side Diff: Clearly see the original text and the AI-generated
  4. suggestion, with deletions highlighted.
  5. One-Click Replace: Update single or multiple text layers in your Figma file
  6. instantly.
  7. One-Step Undo: Easily revert any replacement back to the previous text.
  8. Flexible LLM Support: Choose between Google's Gemini (requires API
  9. key) or a self-hosted Ollama instance with your favorite local models. (OpenAI
  10. coming soon!)
  11. Easy Configuration: Simple settings panel to manage your LLM provider
  12. and credentials.
  13. Light & Dark Mode: Adapts automatically or lets you choose via settings.
  14. Free Tier: Get started with 10 free AI generations per day!


Who is it for?

  1. UI/UX Designers: Quickly iterate on microcopy, button labels, and placeholder
  2. Copywriters & Marketers: Draft, refine, and translate marketing copy directly
  3. within design mockups.
  4. Content Creators: Ensure consistency and clarity in text across designs.
  5. Anyone who works with text in Figma!


Getting Started & Configuration Guide

  1. Install: Install the "Content Writer Agent" plugin from the Figma Community.
  2. Run: Right-click on the Figma canvas -> Plugins -> Content Writer Agent.
  3. Basic Use:
  4. Select one or more text layers in your Figma file. The plugin UI will update automatically.
  5. Enter a prompt in the input field (e.g., "Make this punchier").
  6. Click "Generate".
  7. Review the original and generated text in the cards.
  8. Click "Replace" on a card to update that specific text layer in Figma, or
  9. "Replace All Valid" to update all cards with valid generated text.
  10. If you replaced text, an "Undo" button appears allowing you to revert that specific change.
  11. Configure Your AI Provider (Settings):
  12. Click the Settings icon ( ) in the plugin header or the clickable provider tag next to it.
  13. Choose Provider: Select "Gemini", "Ollama", "OpenAI", or "Custom Model..." from the "LLM Provider" dropdown.

a) Gemini Setup:

  1. Select "Gemini" in the dropdown.
  2. You need a Google AI API Key. You can get one for free from Google
  3. AI Studio.
  4. Click the "Get your Gemini API Key" link or visit https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey.
  5. Copy your generated API key.
  6. Paste the key into the "Gemini API Key" input field in the plugin settings.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".

b) Ollama Setup:

  1. Select "Ollama" in the dropdown.
  2. Ensure Ollama is Installed & Running: You need Ollama running on
  3. your local machine or a reachable server. If you haven't installed it, visit ollama.com.
  4. Enter Server URL: Input the URL where your Ollama server is running (default is http://localhost:11434 ).
  5. Fetch & Select Model: Click the "Refresh" button ( ) next to the URL field. The plugin will attempt to connect and fetch the list of models available on your Ollama server. Select the desired model (e.g., llama3:latest , mistral:latest ) from the "Model Name" dropdown.
  6. (IMPORTANT) CORS Configuration: If fetching models fails (especially with Failed to fetch errors), your Ollama server likely needs CORS configuration to allow requests from Figma. See the detailed instructions within the settings panel error message for help.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".


Need Help or a Custom Model?

If you encounter issues, need support for a different model/provider, or have

feedback, please reach out!

Request Custom Model/Provider: Select "Custom Model..." from the LLM

Provider dropdown in Settings and use the contact link.

General Support/Feedback: Email ahmmigo0@gmail.com

Stop wasting time on repetitive text edits. Install Content Writer Agent and let AI

accelerate your design workflow!
plugins.tagline: Your Content AI Text Assistant in Figma (Choose your prefered LLM model)

  5. Enter a prompt in the input field (e.g., "Make this punchier").
  6. Click "Generate".
  7. Review the original and generated text in the cards.
  8. Click "Replace" on a card to update that specific text layer in Figma, or
  9. "Replace All Valid" to update all cards with valid generated text.
  10. If you replaced text, an "Undo" button appears allowing you to revert that specific change.
  11. Configure Your AI Provider (Settings):
  12. Click the Settings icon ( ) in the plugin header or the clickable provider tag next to it.
  13. Choose Provider: Select "Gemini", "Ollama", "OpenAI", or "Custom Model..." from the "LLM Provider" dropdown.

a) Gemini Setup:

  1. Select "Gemini" in the dropdown.
  2. You need a Google AI API Key. You can get one for free from Google
  3. AI Studio.
  4. Click the "Get your Gemini API Key" link or visit https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey.
  5. Copy your generated API key.
  6. Paste the key into the "Gemini API Key" input field in the plugin settings.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".

b) Ollama Setup:

  1. Select "Ollama" in the dropdown.
  2. Ensure Ollama is Installed & Running: You need Ollama running on
  3. your local machine or a reachable server. If you haven't installed it, visit ollama.com.
  4. Enter Server URL: Input the URL where your Ollama server is running (default is http://localhost:11434 ).
  5. Fetch & Select Model: Click the "Refresh" button ( ) next to the URL field. The plugin will attempt to connect and fetch the list of models available on your Ollama server. Select the desired model (e.g., llama3:latest , mistral:latest ) from the "Model Name" dropdown.
  6. (IMPORTANT) CORS Configuration: If fetching models fails (especially with Failed to fetch errors), your Ollama server likely needs CORS configuration to allow requests from Figma. See the detailed instructions within the settings panel error message for help.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".


Need Help or a Custom Model?

If you encounter issues, need support for a different model/provider, or have

feedback, please reach out!

Request Custom Model/Provider: Select "Custom Model..." from the LLM

Provider dropdown in Settings and use the contact link.

General Support/Feedback: Email ahmmigo0@gmail.com

Stop wasting time on repetitive text edits. Install Content Writer Agent and let AI

accelerate your design workflow!
131016.tagline: Your Content AI Text Assistant in Figma (Choose your prefered LLM model)

plugins.name: Clean layers
plugins.description:
With Clean layers, you're able to find unnamed layers, components, and stray instances (which are component instances that no longer have a parent component), helping you maintain a clean file that's properly organized and synced.


This makes your design workflow smoother and ensures your files are easy to navigate and collaborate on.

plugins.name: Peppercorn - Find Centroids (Visual Center)
plugins.description:
Find the geometric center (centroid) of vector shapes.

This experimental plugin calculates the centroid to determine the center of shapes.

ðŸ‘‰ Usage

  1. Place your shape in a container for better experience
  2. Select the shape
  3. Run the plugin


âš ï¸ Note

  1. This plugin is experimental and may not work perfectly for all shapes
  2. The centroid method works best for simple and symmetrical shapes
  3. For complex or highly irregular shapes, the centroid may not always represent the visual center


ðŸ› ï¸ Future Updates

  1. We plan to add visual guides to help you understand the centroid's position
  2. Considering additional methods like the smallest enclosing circle for more complex shapes

Plugin Introduction

This plugin is a handy tool for aligning selected nodes in FigJam. It supports horizontal and vertical alignment, as well as custom grid alignment with a specified number of columns. Additionally, it allows you to adjust the spacing between nodes, making it easy to achieve efficient and visually consistent designs.


Key Features

  1. Horizontal Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single horizontal row.
  2. Vertical Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single vertical column.
  3. Custom Grid Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a grid with the specified number of columns.
  4. Spacing Adjustment: Allows you to freely adjust the spacing between nodes.


How to Use

  1. Select the nodes you want to align.
  2. Set the number of columns and the spacing in the plugin interface.
  3. Click or drag the Horizontal Alignment, Vertical Alignment, or the stepper.
  4. The nodes will be aligned according to the settings.
plugins.tagline: Multiple nodes can be easily aligned. The number of columns and spacing can also be easily set.

plugins.name: Iconsynx
plugins.description:
ICONSYNX plugin converts SVG icons into WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot) with seamless React, Vue, and TypeScript integration. Easily generate custom icon fonts, automate GitHub PR creation, and streamline your workflow. Perfect for teams managing CSS-based icon fonts while working with modern JavaScript frameworks.


Privacy Note:

To enable GitHub PR automation, this plugin requires access to your GitHub repository via a personal access token (GitHub token). The token is used only for creating pull requests and is stored securely. No sensitive data is collected or shared.


ðŸ”¹ Key Features:

âœ… Convert Figma SVGs to WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot)

âœ… One-click WebFont generation for seamless icon management

âœ… React & Vue support for easy integration in frontend projects

âœ… TypeScript compatibility for strongly-typed icon components

âœ… Automated GitHub PRs to update icon sets effortlessly

âœ… Optimized font bundles to reduce file size and improve performance

Save once, use anytime

  1. Save your favorite colors and easily access them next time without hassle.

âœ¨ Not satisfied with your purchase? You can always contact the Figma team for a refund.


Three easy steps to get started

Pro tips to enhance your workflow

plugins.name: FigmaUser
plugins.description: The FigmaUser plugin is designed for users who need to extract more data from their Figma files when using the BlocksIn App. With this plugin, you can easily get user IDs to create Figma Activity Graphs and reports. This enhances the collaboration experience by unlocking additional insights from your Figma projects. Simple and effective, FigmaUser is a great tool for teams looking to maximize their use of Figma. More info about BlocksIn App: https://blocksin.com/
plugins.tagline: Get Figma User Id

plugins.name: Superselect
plugins.description: Select multiple layers in your Figma page by just adding filters. This enables you to easily multitask between layers which have same color, text, type, name, etc.
plugins.tagline: A powerful and simple way to select layers in Figma

76238.name: Superselect
76238.description: Select multiple layers in your Figma page by just adding filters. This enables you to easily multitask between layers which have same color, text, type, name, etc.
76238.release_notes: Fix some bugs that caused the search function to only filter against top-level layers ignoring their children. Also, fixed a bug that caused an issue with converting RGB colors to HEX.
76238.tagline: A powerful and simple way to select layers in Figma
